subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: On PALM
msgSnippet: ... And FORCE would be better as COARSE, too.  But I bet Wells had reasons, at least in the case of father , for not using them.  I have already mentioned
messageBody:
Anthony Grahn scripsit:

> the lexical set PALM would be better exemplified by FATHER
> the lexical set CURE would be better exemplified by TOUR

And FORCE would be better as COARSE, too. But I bet Wells had reasons,
at least in the case of "father", for not using them. I have already
mentioned that there are accents in English that put "father" into FACE;
that may have been the reason. England has more dialectal diversity
than the rest of the anglosphere put together, for reasons I believe
I've already explained. Similarly, it would be terrible to use "pen"
instead of "dress" for DRESS, because of all the U.S. Southerners who put
"pen" in KIT.

Eventually I will have to bite the bullet and spend the $100 or so to
buy a copy of Accents of English, his 3-volume 1982 work on the subject.

--
In politics, obedience and support John Cowan <cowan@...>
are the same thing. --Hannah Arendt http://www.ccil.org/~cowan
